greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number that takes n steps to reach 1 under iteration of sum-of-squares-of-digits map (= smallest "happy number" of height n).
comment: Subsequent terms are too large to display in full.
a(9) = 78889 * 10^((a(8) - 305)/81) - 1 (78888 followed by (421 * 10^973 - 34)/9 9's, specified by Warut Roonguthai for UPINT3).
reference: Richard K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Sect. E34. (2nd ed. UPINT2 = 1994, 3rd ed. UPINT3 = 2004)
link: Tianxin Cai & Xia Zhou, On The Heights of Happy Numbers, Rocky Mountain J. Math., Vol. 38, No. 6 (2008), 1921-1926.
H. G. Grundman, E. A. Teeple, Heights of happy numbers and cubic happy numbers, Fib Quart. 41 (4) (2003) 301
Gabriel Lapointe, On finding the smallest happy numbers of any heights, arXiv:1904.12032 [math.NT], 2019.
May Mei, Andrew Read-McFarland, Numbers and the Heights of their Happiness, arXiv:1511.01441 [math.NT], 2015.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
